texts.value: Receptor for angiotensin II, a vasoconstricting peptide, which acts as a key regulator of blood pressure and sodium retention by the kidney (PubMed:15611106, PubMed:1567413, PubMed:25913193, PubMed:26420482, PubMed:30639100, PubMed:32079768, PubMed:8987975). The activated receptor in turn couples to G-alpha proteins G(q) (GNAQ, GNA11, GNA14 or GNA15) and thus activates phospholipase C and increases the cytosolic Ca(2+) concentrations, which in turn triggers cellular responses such as stimulation of protein kinase C (PubMed:15611106)

(Microbial infection) During SARS coronavirus-2/SARS-CoV-2 infection, it is able to recognize and internalize the complex formed by secreted ACE2 and SARS-CoV-2 spike protein through DNM2/dynamin 2-dependent endocytosis

Strongly inhibited by anti-hypertensive drugs losartan, candesartan, valsartan, irbesartan, telmisartan, eprosartan, olmesartan and azilsartan, most of which share a common biphenyl-tetrazole scaffold
Interacts with MAS1 (PubMed:15809376). Interacts with ARRB1 (By similarity). Interacts with FLNA (via filamin repeat 21); increases PKA-mediated phosphorylation of FLNA (PubMed:26460884)
Liver, lung, adrenal and adrenocortical adenomas
C-terminal Ser or Thr residues may be phosphorylated

disease.description: Autosomal recessive severe disorder of renal tubular development characterized by persistent fetal anuria and perinatal death, probably due to pulmonary hypoplasia from early-onset oligohydramnios (the Potter phenotype).

texts.value: The disease is caused by variants affecting the gene represented in this entry
Belongs to the G-protein coupled receptor 1 family

features.description: Abolished binding to angiotensin II; abolished binding to olmesartan inhibitor.
Abolished binding to angiotensin II; abolished binding to olmesartan inhibitor.
Induces a conformational change in the angiotensin II-binding pocket, leading to constitutive activation of the receptor.
Abolished binding to angiotensin II; abolished binding to olmesartan inhibitor.
Reduced binding to angiotensin II without affecting binding to candesartan inhibitor.
Slightly affects binding to eprosartan inhibitor.
Mimics the disordered side chain induced by angiotensin II-binding; increased affinity for G-protein subunit alpha proteins. Decreased affinity for telmisartan.
